resources.string: "FakeStandby requires this functionality to make it possible to control every screen and every app. This feature will only used to provide the functionality of the app and will not access, save, collect or share any data."
"A required service for FakeStandby is not running. Please restart your device."

"This app is not permitted to display overlays over other apps. To run this app, you need to grant the \\"Display over other apps\\" permission for FakeStandby. This permission makes it possible for this app to display content over the content of other apps. To grant this permission, enable the switch on the following screen."

"FakeStandby is not enabled in you device's accessibility settings. To run this app, that service has to be enabled. Simply open the accessibility settings, scroll down to FakeStandby and enable it. On some devices you may look for the option under \\"installed services\\""
"Tap the screen with 4 or more simultaneous touches"
"Choose the methods that can be used to escape the fake standby state"
"No close method set for the fake standby"
"If this app is not currently available in your native language, you can help translate it to allow it to go around the world!"
"Visit GitHub to see all the source code."
"Always show a notification to start the fake standby"
"Use this option if your device does not support custom Quick Settings tiles."
"When enabled, the fake standby will begin as soon as the accessibility service is started. For example, after boot."
"Open the device's accessibility settings to manage the accessibility service for FakeStandby."
Enable this if the FakeStandby appears in white due to dark mode.

If enabled, the FakeStandby will deactivate itself after 15 seconds after is has been started. This is to test if the app works on your phone and to prevent that you accidentally lock yourself out of your phone. Set this switch to off as soon as you have verified that you can turn off the FakeStandby after starting it.
